newsitem.title: USA: Collins Q1 results hurt by delivery delays.
newsitem.headline: Collins Q1 results hurt by delivery delays.

text.p: Collins Industries Inc said on Friday that delays in chassis deliveries due to suppliers' production problems will drag down its first-quarter results by $300,000, or $0.04 per share.
Collins' first fiscal quarter ended January 31..

Collins also said its bus operations would be hurt in the second quarter by Ford Motor Co's anticipated closing of its Lorain, Ohio plant. The shutdown is connected to a dispute between the United Auto Workers and Johnson Controls Inc, a key supplier for the Lorain plant.
Production problems at Ford and Chevrolet delayed first-quarter chassis deliveries to Collins, which makes buses, ambulances and terminal trucks, among other products.
Chevrolet has told Collins it can meet future delivery requirements, but a prolonged strike affecting Ford would hurt Collins' ambulance operations, the company said.
